intro: Ipomoea valenzuelensis f. glabrescens, commonly known as the velvet morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, featuring heart-shaped leaves and a rapid growth habit. Its f. glabrescens form is distinguished by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves, giving it a more refined appearance compared to the typical variety. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to warm, humid climates.
